speaker: Alex
text: Hey Priya, I just finished reviewing your code. Overall, your recent commits are cleaner and more consistent than last month’s. Great job!
ipa: heɪ ˈpriːjə | aɪ dʒəst ˈfɪnɪʃt rɪˈvjuːɪŋ jʊr koʊd | ˈoʊvɚˌɔl | jʊr ˈriːsənt kəˈmɪts ɑr ˈkliːnɚ ənd mɔr kənˈsɪstənt ðən læst mʌnθs | ɡreɪt dʒɑb

"just finished" → /dʒəst ˈfɪnɪʃt/ (t links to f)
"reviewing your" → /rɪˈvjuːɪŋ jʊr/ (g links to y)
"cleaner and" → /ˈkliːnɚ ənd/ (r links to a)

speaker: Priya
text: Thanks, Alex! I’ve been trying to write more readable functions and reduce the number of nested conditions. I think the result is much easier to maintain.

speaker: Alex
text: Absolutely. I also noticed your tests are running faster now.

speaker: Priya
text: Yeah! I refactored the mock data generation. Now the suite runs almost twice as fast as before.

speaker: Alex
text: Nice. Compared to others on the team, your modules are loading with less latency. Only Omar’s service is performing just as well.

speaker: Alex
text: Honestly, the UI integration part was less seamless than the API work, though. Any blockers?

speaker: Priya
text: Yes, I had trouble aligning the styles. Our CSS variables are not as flexible as they should be.

speaker: Alex
text: I agree. We’ll schedule some time to clean that up. But I’ll say your bug rate has been significantly lower than the team average.
